project.name: C-C120A-CTRE-01-ST04-DT02-DF11-CF20-01
project.description: Creating test case using base program. Added an environment variable read to get a key in order to read in data from shared memory. Completed injection.

build_commands.command: make install CC="$SS_CC" LD="$SS_LNK" CFLAGS="$CFLAGS" CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS" LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS" prefix="$SS_TC_ROOT/$SS_TC_INSTALL" LIBS="$LIBS"

iopair.name: C-C120A-CTRE-01-ST04-DT02-DF11-CF20-01-GOOD-01
iopair.description: Has a fixed stack buffer of size 64. (char [64])

process.script: nohup shm_setup -k 4150 -s 1001 -m "AAA" -o /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.out 2>&1 & echo $! > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid && echo "Shared memory created"
if [[ $(wc -c "$SS_LOG_EXECUTE_STDOUT" | cut -d " " -f 1) -eq $(wc -c "$SS_TC_ROOT/$SS_TC_SCORE/good-01/output.txt" | cut -d " " -f 1) ]]; then echo "SIMILAR"; else echo "DIFFERENT"; fi;

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid" ]]; then killtree.sh -s 9 -p $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid") && echo "Killed shared memory server."; else echo "Failed: Shared memory server PID file does not exist."; fi

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id" ]]; then ipcrm -m $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id") && echo "Deleted shared memory segment."; else echo "Failed: Shared memory ID file does not exist."; fi

scoring_formula.formula: STDOUT-REPORT-01 AND STDOUT-CONTENT-LENGTH-01 AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

iopair.name: C-C120A-CTRE-01-ST04-DT02-DF11-CF20-01-BAD-02
iopair.description: Has a fixed stack buffer of size 64. (char [64])

process.script: nohup shm_setup -k 4150 -s 1001 -m "I've reached a point where I feel the need to express my disappointment with Gov. Common W Enumeration. There are a number of reasons Gov. Enumeration isn't telling us as to why he wants to obfuscate the issue so that one can't see what ought to be completely obvious to all. In this letter, I will expose those reasons one-by-one, on the principle that his argument that the sky is falling is hopelessly flawed and thoroughly circuitous. His cold, analytical approach to philistinism doesn't take into account the human element. In particular, those who have been hurt by philistinism know that Gov. Enumeration's jobations emblematize an increasing deturpation of cultural standards and a triumph of the meretricious. Get that straight, please. Any other thinking is blame-shoving or responsibility-dodging. Furthermore, Gov. Enumeration wants to eavesdrop on all types of private conversations. Why he wants that, I don't know, but that's what he wants." -o /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.out 2>&1 & echo $! > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid && echo "Shared memory created"
if [[ $(wc -c "$SS_LOG_EXECUTE_STDOUT" | cut -d " " -f 1) -eq $(wc -c "$SS_TC_ROOT/$SS_TC_SCORE/good-05/output.txt" | cut -d " " -f 1) ]]; then echo "SIMILAR"; else echo "DIFFERENT"; fi;

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid" ]]; then killtree.sh -s 9 -p $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid") && echo "Killed shared memory server."; else echo "Failed: Shared memory server PID file does not exist."; fi

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id" ]]; then ipcrm -m $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id") && echo "Deleted shared memory segment."; else echo "Failed: Shared memory ID file does not exist."; fi
